title: Time, Speed, and Distance
description: This aptitude test assesses advanced Time Speed and Distance concepts within a 30-minute timeframe. It focuses on calculating average and relative speeds, and solving intricate motion problems involving trains, boats, and circular paths, requiring formula application and scenario evaluation.

questions.question: Scenario: A car travels 100 km at 50 km/h and 200 km at 100 km/h. Evaluate: Which route is more efficient for average speed?
What is the average speed for a 60 km trip if half is at 40 km/h and half at 60 km/h?
Create: What formula gives the time when two trains moving in opposite directions at 60 km/h and 40 km/h meet if 200 km apart?
Scenario: Two cars start 300 km apart and travel toward each other at 50 km/h and 70 km/h. When will they meet?
A train 100 m long passes a pole in 5 seconds. What is its speed?
Evaluate: Why is relative speed used for objects moving in opposite directions?
options: It accounts for combined closing speed
questions.correctAnswer: It accounts for combined closing speed

questions.question: Scenario: A boat travels 12 km upstream in 2 hours and 12 km downstream in 1 hour. What is the stream speed?
What is the time taken to cover 240 km at 80 km/h?
Create: How would you calculate the relative speed of two cars moving in the same direction at 60 km/h and 40 km/h?
Scenario: A man runs 400 m in a circle at 8 m/s. How many laps in 5 minutes?
A train crosses a 200 m bridge in 20 seconds at 10 m/s. What is its length?
Evaluate: Why is average speed not the arithmetic mean of two speeds over equal distances?
Scenario: Two runners on a 1 km circular track start opposite each other at 5 m/s and 3 m/s. When do they first meet?
What is the relative speed of two objects moving in opposite directions at 15 m/s and 25 m/s?
Create: What formula gives the distance covered at average speed S over time T?
Scenario: A car travels 50 km at 25 km/h and returns at 50 km/h. What’s the average speed?
A boat’s speed in still water is 10 km/h, and the river flows at 2 km/h. What’s its upstream speed?
Evaluate: Why does circular motion complicate meeting time calculations?
Scenario: Two trains 150 m and 200 m long pass each other in 10 seconds at 20 m/s and 15 m/s. Are they moving in opposite directions?
Create: How would you find the time for two objects 100 km apart moving toward each other at 20 km/h and 30 km/h?
What is the speed if a 300 m train crosses a 200 m platform in 25 seconds?
Scenario: A man walks 4 km/h and runs 6 km/h. What’s his average speed for 12 km if he walks half and runs half?
What is the relative speed of two cars moving in the same direction at 80 km/h and 60 km/h?
Evaluate: Why is downstream speed higher than upstream?
Create: What formula gives the time for a train to pass a man if its length is L and speed is S?
Scenario: A cyclist covers 20 km at 10 km/h and 30 km at 15 km/h. What’s the total time?
A train crosses a 100 m pole in 4 seconds at 25 m/s. What’s its length?
Scenario: Two objects 50 km apart move in the same direction at 20 km/h and 10 km/h. When will the faster catch up?
Evaluate: Why is average speed critical in multi-leg journeys?
Create: How would you find the average speed for 60 km at 30 km/h and 40 km at 20 km/h?
